sentences.sContent: I taught him how to change a fuse .
A bomb was deactivated at the last moment, after the fuse had been lit.
sentences.sCn: 一枚炸弹在导火线已被点燃后的最后一刻被解除。

sentences.sContent: The skull bones fuse between the ages of fifteen and twenty-five.

synos.tran: [电]保险丝；[军][矿业]导火线，雷管

phrases.pCn: [美国口语]容易激动，脾气急躁，动辄发怒

words.tran: [物] 熔化的，[化学] 熔凝的；装有保险丝的

trans.tranOther: a short thin piece of wire inside electrical equipment which prevents damage by melting and stopping the electricity when there is too much power

trans.tranCn: 结合; 融合; 熔合
trans.tranOther: if electrical equipment fuses, or if you fuse it, it stops working because a fuse has melted
